review: Wish I could give this place zero stars.  I could nit-pick about all the things that went wrong but I won't. I'll just say I won't ever go back there. Service is terrible, food mediocre at best and drinks watered down.
Really bad Service Hostess & Waitress with attitude...

I came here last Saturday for my friend's 21st birthday dinner. The place was pretty empty, and in our group is was about 7 of us, so I'm confused as to why it took the servers about 10 minutes to come and greet us and give us the menus. Anyways, I guess there were so many servers on the floor that they didn't know who should come to us.  The girl who ended up being our server was really nice and got our orders a-okay. I was kind of skeptical because she didn't even write down what the entire table of seven needed and memorized it all. I was waiting for her to screw up, but nope, she was on key. I ordered a bacon burger and a mai tai, but honestly didn't enjoy the mai tai that much. It didn't taste sweet at all as I've had at other places, so it was just okay. Not that bad. Would I come here again? Sure, if I needed to grab some drinks somewhere close with a friend. Otherwise, I'd probably go somewhere else.

...the only reason I come here is because the Carson area is limited. The service sucks, the bar tenders and servers have attitudes and shows no interest in the customer, may I add they have no personality. I've sent emails to other franchises encouraging them to open nearby because chili's service is not worth a $1 tip

The most disappointing thing EVER was that there was a security guard walking down the table aisles every 10 minutes!! Our appetizer took about 20 minutes then our entree took about an hour! I asked for decaf, they gave me regular. the Menus are greasy and so are the salt and pepper shakers. THE BATHROOMS OMG THEY ARE DISGUSTING!! we had 2 different servers. Sweeping while we're eating. And the list should go on but that should give you a clear picture.

On 2/18/12 my husband and kids decided to eat at Chili's after we filed our taxes. We live in West Covina and often eat there. I must say I was very wrong thinking that all Chilis's followed the same mission and values........Boy was I WRONG!!!! 1. Waited about 30 minutes to get seated after I was told 10-15 minutes wait then I looked and there were about eight 8 tables. 2. Our waiter was Cesar was AWESOME very courteous and attentive. 3. Order a regular Margarita had to send back thick like slurpe, and very strong not from alcohol but from the syrup. The waiter came back and apologized and said that was a very bad Margarita would you like something else said No thanks, I'll pass. He said he tasted and informed the Manager, and the Bartender.  4. I ordered the Old Timer Burger and asked for mustard asked a waiter that was passing by. When he handled me the bottle and did not realize that it was full of dust (like the dust that builds up on ceiling fans blades) the bottle was dirty like they had not clean it in months, after the dust fell unto my burger I immediately lost my appetite . I asked the waiter to please see the bottle, which he immediately removed and again apologized. I then asked to speak to a manager which took a while to get someone to come to the table. It was a female manager informed about the problem, but did not see and she apologized. As I was talking to the my waiter Dave Mills General Manager came to the table. First time I have ever encounter a GM who the first out of his mouth are " What seems to be the problem"? No "i'm sorry to hear there's a problem can you please tell me what happen?' But instead indicated "So you got a bad bottle"?  I told him that was not acceptable and he responded "Seems like your trashing the Chili's. I was in shock of how this GM was handling the situation and talking to the waiter after the waiter told him about the Margarita. He seemed to have gotten upset that he had tried it to determine the problem.    It was so bad that the table next to us was so applauded of what they were hearing from this GM, that she gave me her number.  Bottom line bad service from GM which made this dining experience a nightmare! He has no business being a GM or needs to seriously be retrained!!!

Great experience as always. I actually went two times in one day. I'm really addicted to the Caribbean Salad with chicken and shrimp.  The southwest chicken and sausage soup is good as well. This location is cool, but I like the one in Inglewood better. Better service and stiffer drinks.

This place absolutely SUCKS! Do not get served from Charles or Richard! When we asked to get seated (there was 5 of us), we noticed there were 3 tables clean and available for us and the host told us it would be about 15 to 20 minutes!!! WTF really? Now about Charles and Richard (why we needed 2 waiters I dont know why)....Once we got to our tables it took close to 10 minutes to even see the waiters, plus we needed a highchair for my daughter and that took forever! Then we ordered drinks and that took another 10 minutes!  Please believe that it wasnt crazy packed or anything tonight, but here and it has takes 5 to 10 minutes or more to get anything AND you have ask them at least 2-3 times (or another waiter) before you get what you need.  I'm not about firing someone for doing their job, but if retraining is needed, it best be now or they will lose their jobs!   Now lets get to the food...  We ordered chips and salsa, and my goodness.. some of the chips were either too stale, too oily, too salty, or all of the above.  I ordered the chicken fajita meal and low and behold I get more SALT.  My girl ordered the fajita trio and she got the same salty grilled onions.  YUCK!  The grilled onions/peppers were way too salty, but I would have to say everything else was ok, but man chef...easy of the salt! Then we get my daughter the kids chicken tenders meal.  The batter on it looked like its was burned (dark brown) and looked no where pleasing to the eye for a kid to eat, and she was  reluctant to eat it.   The next time I go to a restaurant chain like this again, I will make sure to read Yelp first! Now excuse me while I drop a salt lake city utah. LOL
The food is good, and the Happy hour is awesome. The bartender April was quick and very friendly! They have a great bar area to watch all ur favorite games, and its just a nice chill hang out spot.

The absolute worst service ever!!! I placed an on-line order at 10:30am and their website says pick up time was 11:17am.  I arrived at 11:20am and was asked to pay and wait.  I didn't get my food until 12:10pm! I placed my order at 10:30am trying to beat the lunch rush, these F-IDIOTS made my order part of the rush! As I was waiting along with others who came in after me, the manager tried saying they were backed up because all the orders came in at once; I told her NO, that my order was placed on-line at 10:30am and she tried making another excuse because she knew I caught her in a lie. They never even gave me a chance to walk out because they collected my money as soon as I walked in and never said how long it was going to be; they just kept saying 10 more minutes every time I asked how much longer it would take. When my order of 6 entrees finally came out (regular menu items, nothing special), there were 2 orders missing!  As I checked through each order, I asked where the last 2 were and they acted like I offended them by asking where the rest of my order was.  They brought out the 5th order and acted like that was the last of it.  I asked them where 6 was and they go to the back and bring it out.  All the portions were smaller than usual.  They even forgot my chips and guacamole, which only had a few kernels of corn and 2 small slices of avocado. This is the 3rd time I've order lunch from this place on-line and every time was slow, this being the slowest.  When someone pays $100 for lunch, this is NOT the type of service or lack of quality one should expect. NEVER going back to this Chili's again.  The only reason I came back today was because it's the closest one to my work. Those idiots even forgot to give me a receipt!!!
Great trio fajitas! My steak, chicken and shrimps were perfectly grilled and our waitress, Virginia, is the best! Love it!
Came with the fam to have a weekend lunch. Virginia was a very attentive waitress who gave great service. We ordered the fajitas and shrimp tacos and it was cooked perfectly. Overall good experience.

Went here after a business meeting nearby -- because there were no other options -- and we all liked it. The food was pretty darn good -- healthy and fresh. We ordered salads, sandwiches and tacos. Everyone liked their food. Service was AWESOME. I don't know who our waitress was but every time our drinks got half full, we'd get a brand new glass with a new drink so we'd have 1.5 drinks in front of us constantly. I know it's Chili's and we're not supposed to like big national chains but the food and selection on the menu were really good. If I were to give this four stars for being Chili's, it wouldn't be fair to a standalone independent restaurant. I wouldn't drive down to Carson just for this Chili's location, but we were all happy with our business lunch. Two of my colleagues were visiting from New York City, which we joked about taking them to a fancy place before we sat down, but it worked.

I have to say that I am disappointed with this Chili's.  The food is what you would expect from this chain restaurant; no more no less.  I work in the Gardena/Carson area so the choices for work lunches are relegated to a few places in the general vicinity of my office, and this location is one of them.  My disappointment in my experience there today is directed at management.  I happened to leave my cell phone on the dining table we ate at.  That is totally my fault, and I take full responsibility for that.  However, my cell phone disappeared after an extremely short time (i.e. walked to my car, realized I didn't have my phone, walked back in).  The table had just been bussed, but no one had seen the phone.  Hmmm.  The manager took my name and number but didn't seem to go to any extra effort to assist in spite of the short time that had elapsed. I also spoke to the women seated near us that were still there, and they said the only people that had been by the table were the servers.   Well, I'll check ebay tonight to see if my phone is there.  In the meantime, I don't recommend this restaurant, or just make sure you don't leave any personal items there for five minutes or more.....

I have to say that this is some terrible food. Overcooked, salty but bland at the same time, and less than great customer service. Even for a Chili's this is terrible because usually it's at least three-star worthy.

I continue to be amazed at how bad service can be. No drink refill during an hour meal. Burger over cooked. Waited 9 minutes for ticket after asked for. Checked in on four square and received free chips and salsa but was on tab. Took eleven minutes to find manager to take it off. Left worst tip I ever have anywhere. I need to work harder so I can afford nicer places. You should. Dump

Service @ bar is molasses slow. Food @ any Chili's is already nasty as hell but beer is pre-made & still no greeting @ door or in bar. Bad service AND no Saturday happy hour. I'm going back to TGIFriday's.

First thought, cool, Chili's in Carson!  Second time there, second time being asked to wait 20 minutes while open tables were everywhere. Humm.  Eventually we sat ourselves at a table in the bar.  (the only reason we went there again was because of a Gift Card and it was local)   The waiter took forever and the only music  that was playing was R&B, That's Ok, but, is African Americans all they cater too!!!   Finally got some drinks and appetizers ( the food was good, the only reason for ONE STAR), but when we asked for the check, the waiter brought us two!    One for the food and a seemingly bogus one for the drinks and told us don't worry about it just pay both of them, he said "hes hooking me up"  Meaning he was going to POCKET the money for the drinks at a discount for us.  I don't give a shit, but seemed strange inside of a CHILI'S... from a stranger waiter.  That place is not going to last there with that current team of employees.

So I went here with some friends from CSUDH recently for the happy hour special, and VEGETARIANS BEWARE: if you order the black bean burger patty on your happy hour sliders, they will still put meat on there in the form of bacon on your bun. Why on earth they would do that, I have no idea! BE CAREFUL if you or anybody in your party is vegetarian because they will be kind enough to substitute the happy hour burger special with a blackbean burger patty, but you gotta tell them, no bacon bits on the bun! I got the two mini slider burger thing with fries, and they were ok, but I had to take part of the bun off because it was covered in bacon. They get two stars because I only spent five dollars.

This Chili's location is worst than mediocre. The food wasn't anything special but just OK and actually, I'm fine with this. The contributing factor for this low review is based on the customer service which is really crappy. My server took 15min to just bring freaking drinks! After that I ordered and it took another 20min to get the appetizer which was salsa and chips. Seriously just plain and simple: salsa and chips!  Then guess what...? The main dish took another 25min  to be served. So you get the idea, by the time I received my main dish I was already full from the soda and chips. To make things even worse my ghetto server just left or finished her shift without saying a word so I waited an waited till I was unfortunate to get another even crappier server. So the message is  avoid this whack location and go to another Chili's, unless you love to waste your time seating down waiting like a dog for someone to notice you.

The service wasn't great, I waited for my food for about 20mins after everyone in my group got there meals. I asked for a refill  repeatedly and had to wave down a different waitress to get my drink. The food was good was good though.

Upon entering the Carson, CA location, I saw many empty tables and thought "great, we will be seated right away" yet was told it would be a 5-10 minute wait. I asked why since there were tables available and was told they needed to be bussed. The hostess stated they only had three servers for the entire restaurant. Having restaurant management experience myself, I knew this was a good indicator that the restaurant is mismanaged and the hostess agreed.   Once seated, Charles noticed we hadn't been waited on and was quick to respond. He quickly apologized for the wait and asked to take our order. We ordered everything at once for fear we would have to wait extra long between our drink order, appetizer and entrees but Charles proved us wrong and delivered our drinks and food quickly (perhaps because he saw I was drafting this review?).   Our appetizer (Tostada Chips & Fire-Grilled Corn Guacamole) came with greasy and overcooked chips. Our dinners (Margarita Grilled Chicken) were only warm and we thought about sending them back to be microwaved but again, we feared it would take too long so we ate them anyway.   The food was good and it was clear Charles and the rest of the crew were making a good effort to take care of as many customers as they could while serving the food in a timely manner. Since I witnessed the wait staff and food runners diligently working to provide the best service possible, I can only surmise the problem lies with the poor management running this particular location.   The hostess could have been better trained to open the door for arriving customers as many of Chili's competitors do, take the customer's drink order if the wait staff is busy and maybe even assist with bussing the tables. None of the workers had smiles on their faces and they all seemed to be very stressed. At no point in the evening did I see any signs of a manager.   Despite the good service Charles provided, I don't think I'll be visiting this location again.

Okay were do I start. Do I start with the fact that it took awhile to get our order taken or that the salads came after the main course or the fact that the manager on duty did absolutely nothing about the lateness nor did he come to the table to acknowledge or problems. To sum up the whole experience it was very mediocre something I guess you can expect. DISAPPOINTMENT.  WE HAD A PARTY OF SIX AND WAS CELEBRATING A birthday for my moms friend , I order the 2 for 20 which was okay for the price...lets just say they could have charged 15 dollars for both because thats what it was worth to add insult to injury I asked the waiter who looked like he a had just finished Jr. high school if my drink that he suggested to me was correct after all it looked like someone had taken 3 sips before bring it to the table. It was 3/4 full and it seems to me that everyone there was to busy to take care of any real customer needs. I'm just saying if you have other options go to them before going to this place. #veryunsatisfied

The 2 stars are purely for Dre at the bar.. We came in to watch the Raiders game.. it was pretty packed so we sat at the bar.. Then a table became available and when I went to move to waitress was rather rude and advised us we had to close out at the bar before we could be seated at the booth.. Ummm I can understand if we were seated in the restaurant section but we were in the bar section.. why was it such an effort.. needless to say Dre was kind enough to tansfer the order so we could be seated and eat comfortably.. Thanks Dre... the rest of the crew can pick up their customer service DRASTICALLY.. I asked 1 waitress to fill my water and she forget.. so after 20 minutes and a reminder I finally get my water.. Service like this really makes u want to go somewhere else...

Only one star, because I have put one star. Food was okay.  Pretty much it's chilli's, so no matter what Chili's your at, food should be the least of your worries. The service by far is what kills this place.  Walked in on a Sunday at around 9pm, still with two hour of business time left.  They quoted us for a 30 minute wait but seemed like it was only ten.   Was seated and the waitress that seated us, left the menu and drink menu.  3 minutes pass and then another waitress came and asked us if we were ready to order. Of course we weren't.  We explained that two more people were coming and was told that their order had to be placed by ten. We seemed to be a bit rushed so picked out a few items.   Took around 20 minutes until out waitress came to take our order.  Took 20 minutes until our food came.   So by now we have 15 minutes until the kitchen closes and we are just getting our food.  So much for desert. 5 minutes pass and boom!!  There is our check!  Understanding that there is an hour until closing time.  We got our money and paid while most of us still had about half of our food left.  We figured we would be left alone to enjoy our food and get the drink refills as need but this was expecting too much. 10 on the dot happens and this place become a mad house for closing time.  Keep in mind it is only 10pm maybe a few minutes after.  I am currently still eating at this time.  We asked a different waitress for bags and boxes for our food.  Comes back with bags and boxes, but negates to pick up our empty plates. By then the rest of my party had enough and we decided to leave. For short, expect to wait, expect bad service, expect to be rushed out.

My first Visit: We were waiting at the entrance to get seated along with another couple. A black couple got 5 minutes after us. The waiter came & totally ignored us & seated the black couple which were behind us. Really? We just looked at the other couple thinking the same thing.  My Second Visit we went for happy hour. Customer Service was Great. had a few drinks & food was good. But my gf almost died. She got food poisoning an hour later. Horrible.

No matter how bad I would like to see this business succeed because it is SO close to my house and would be SO convenient for Happy Hour, it fails. Chili's got new signing but seems like the same poor management. Cleanliness, Food quality & Service are major opportunities.

For my monthly dinner with a friend who lives in Irvine, Carson is a nice midpoint for the two of us, as I am in Santa Monica.  We decided to give Chili's a go since we both hadn't been to the restaurant in forever. We arrived around 8PM, and were seated pretty immediately.  Our waitress was very pleasant, but super slow and difficult to find throughout our meal.  We ordered off the 2 for $20 menu (which includes one of the pre-selected appetizers and two entrees) and got: Tostada Chips & Corn Roasted Guacamole Chicken Fajitas Cajun Chicken Pasta The chips and guacamole came out relatively quickly.  The chips were incredibly thin, which caused them to break really easily when trying to scoop the guacamole.  The appetizer came with some salsa when mixed with the guacamole actually tasted pretty yummy.  There wasn't anything special about the guacamole, it was okay. The Cajun Chicken Pasta was not as cajun-y as I thought it was going to be.  I expected some spice and kick to the pasta, but instead it simply tasted like an alfredo sauce.  There was a piece of garlic bread on top of the pasta that was greasy and not-so-flavorful as half of the bread was burnt.  My friend seemed to enjoy her fajitas. Unfortunately, nothing about this location stood out to me.  The food was average and the service was decent.  I was definitely underwhelmed by my experience, and can't say that I have any desire to go back.

good fast friendly service.  delicious shiner bock burger. yummy kids' chicken tender and fries. really good spicy santa fe chicken salad . ok cookie and ice cream thingy. oh, and wine was filled to the rim. gangster, ghetto pour. excellent. not too shabby of spot. we may just come back.

This location is probably the worst one I have ever been to.  Food is still good but the customers and staff are seriously blah people.  Don't think anyone enjoys life while there. (expect me!) Good happy hour and a good spot to stop on the way to a LA Galaxy game!

OOOOOKKKKKKKK HERE WE GOOOOOO SOOOO. Let me start with something positive....................... "I love the name Chili's" (there now this review is officially fair. lol I walked into chili's one day for take out and they took almost 10 minutes for someone to come out and take my order. It was lunch time on a weekday, the place wasn't packed, and about 3 employee's walked right by me and didn't say anything. IF  IT'S NOT YOUR WORK STATION TELL WHOEVER'S WORK STATION IT IS, AND TELL THE GUEST THEY WILL BE RIGHT WITH YOU.  After my order was taken I sat and watched an older gentlemen struggle to find someone to help him find someone to take his order. It made me so sad to see, but eventually he found someone. Also while I was sitting there waiting on my order, the phones were going off that no one was answering. It was the phone to take orders right next to the register at the to go counter. 01/17/13 The second time I went was about 9pm-10pm on a Thursday night. The infamous "If you would like to make a togo order please see the bartender" sign was up. I went to the bartender who looked to be busy and asked for help, she said one minute please I said ok. I was watching the Laker game that was on the screen for about 5 minutes and she came back to me. When she came back to me it was with the worst "hurry up and order"  attitude I've ever seen in the history of food service in my life. She was soooooo rude and I haven't even said 3 words to her yet. She said "so what did you want" with this hurry up and order face continuously nodding to get me to finish, just completely rushing me. (keep in mind, I already new what I wanted, I get the same thing every time. Baby back ribs full rack with original bbq sauce, side of loaded mash, and apples "easy right?" so why was she rushing me???? That order doesn't even take 20 sec to say.) She comes back and ask if that's it once again giving me attitude. YOU WOULD'VE THOUGHT I HIT  HER CAR ON THE WAY IN AND NOW SHE HAD TO SERVE ME OR SOMETHING. Before she finished putting the order in I realized I wanted a black berry lemonade. I'm a bit irritated at this point by her attitude but I'm thinking to myself she's over worked maybe (making excuses for her in my head). I politely said excuse me and she didn't hear me (maybe) so I asked the gentleman facing her to get her attention for me. As she turns around I said actually ma'am I would like a black berry lemonade. She then rolls her eye's takes a deep breath and exhales pretty loud. I generally don't walk out but TODAY WAS THAT DAY!!!!!! My company brings employee's here all the time for a sit down and eat company business meeting. All and all the customer service in this place has a feel of " we don't need your money". From the not answering the phones, to the long wait times to order the to go orders, to the employee's. Most companies have a Good, Better, and Best structure. Carl's Jr for example Best: $6 Burger meal large size. Better: Regular meal large size. Good: individual items (i.e. a single burger, 99 cent chicken sandwich) pretty much something for EVERYONE saying : we don't care if your rich, or a bum on the street,  WE WANT WHATEVER MONEY YOU HAVE, PENNY'S NICKLES DIMES WHATEVER!!!! JUST SPEND IT HERE!!! They lose money daily, DAILY!!! for stupid reasons for the reasons listed above (not answering phones, long wait times to order, and customer service). This chili's has lost my business, I will no longer refer or bring my employee's here. It's sad that a city such as Carson so close to Compton (90746 area) easily adopts a negative connotation, and when a person has to decide whether to go to the chili"s in Torrance or the one in Carson they will make the further drive to go to one that reflects a more upscale community for better customer service. I hope the employee's read this and now understand the low amount of hours they are possibly getting. Henry Ford (the founder of the Ford Motor Company, and sponsor of the development of the assembly line technique of mass production) eliminated a note worthy amount of people in the work force, replacing them with machines. In an economy where it's already rough to find a job, we still see this today. AMC theaters automated ticket buying service which eliminates the people at the window, vending machines in general. I guess to get the desired service I'll just have to go to Chili's online to order, walk in pay and leave don't need a full staff to ring me up after all. After all it would be nice to see that bartender replaced with an App on my cell phone.

I was glad too know that there'd be a chilis in carson, but to my disappointment the service here is bad to say the least. From the waiters to the food bad all around . Placed my order with the waiter after about 20 mins of being seated. Food came like in 30 and was served cold , the least they could've done was serve hot food after such a long wait. I've gone back several time to see if anything has changed . Unfortunately things remain the same, so I end up going to the one in downtown long beach or Lakewood .
Horrible!!!!!!! Worst service ever! Could of gave no stars but I had to give one in order to give a review!

location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: Last night my family and I had the worst experience at Chili's ever. First of we were given a 30/35 minute wait time. We waited patiently for a bit over an hour before we got seated. As we got seated they already knew we where upset of the wait time and said the manager was aware and was going to try to fix things. Manager never showed up and waitress was taking forever to take our order after she had already given us our drinks which she also got wrong. After that we told the hostess we were leaving and were very disappointed at service and walked out. They showed no concern to try to fix the problem and due to that Chili's has lost a customer. It was my families first time trying Chili's and the only thing they got to try was a zip of their drink (for those that got the right drink) and bad customer service. They will never try to eat at Chili's again. We went to wing stop after that and got better service there.

First time I have been to this Chili's location...not impressed.  Generally, I don't like Chili's but my girlfriend loves their burgers.  So since relationships are all about compromise, off to Chili's we went. Seating - First off, we were quoted a wait time of 15 to 20 minutes.  The place was pretty packed so that was fine.  Luckily, or maybe not so luckily, a table opened in the bar area so we took that instead of waiting. Patrons - Please note that since Carson is Compton adjacent, you will have a much rowdier crowd that is borderline or has crossed the line into ratchet territory.  It appears that the staff meets the same criteria as the people who frequent this Chili's location. So expect a lot of hooting and hollering during your dining experience. Staff - When taking the aforementioned table in the bar area, I asked the waitress working the area if the table was open.  Sensed a bit of an attitude but whatever, I kind of expected it. She then proceeds to clean the table with a towel by wiping all the crumbs and leftover remnants onto the floor and seats.  Nice to know they keep the place in such tip top shape! Food -  Ordered the 2 for $20 deal.  Appetizers were cheese sticks which came out cold.  It was like eating a stick of string cheese coated in batter.  Usually cheese sticks come out a little gooey when they are done being fried.   Ordered the bacon cheese burger as the entrée.  Took a few bites and noticed that the burger was on a wheat bun.  It didn't bother me much but my girlfriend was kinda irked about it.  We asked the waitress what was up and she went to the back. Apparently, they had been out of regular hamburger buns for a few days...seems to me that this place is a little mismanaged.  The least our server could have done was notify us...but she said she hadn't noticed a difference when serving the food for the last few days? Overall, I don't expect much from Chili's or any other chain restaurant but the staff and atmosphere at this location pretty much takes the cake as worst Chili's around.

We eat at Chili's quite often but this was the first at this location. This was the WORST service ever. We had to wait almost 10 minutes to have our drinks ordered,then wait another 20 minutes for our food. Oh and we didn't get refills on our drinks,the waiter never came to check on us. We waited about 20 minutes to get our check and we are still waiting to see the waiter to come close out our bill. I will never come here again! If Richard is working here don't sit in his section

Went to this Chili's with a coworker for Happy Hour around 6:30. It was very packed but we managed to get seated at the bar. We ordered two margaritas and three appetizers. The only positive thing I have to say about this Chili's is the drinks. The Bartender was really trying hard: he was the only one at the entire bar with about 20 some people waiting on him. Unfortunately the rest of it was a disaster. The worst thing about this Chili's is the hygiene. I have no idea how they pass food inspection. While we were sitting at the bar, we noticed that the bartender would grab a used glass, dunk it into a soapy sink, then into the next one with less soap, and finally into one with little soap. He then poured water into that glass and served - with bubbles still on it. Both of us were in disbelief because there's no way that the guy didn't even wipe the glass. But it happened over and over again. What drew the line for us, was when we saw the server drop some fries on the counter next to the dishwash zone, and proceded to put it back onto the plate. It was clearly obvious that some dishwashing soap had gotten on there and both of us stopped eating. Please save yourself some stomach (and heart) ache by avoiding this place at all cost. My goodness this place is disgusting.

Ugh, this is a horrible Chili's.  I usually go to the Chili's in La Habra and the service there is 100x better than this place.  Our server was creepy.  He would stand in the server's station and just stare at us.  C r e e p y...

What? You mean i no longer have to drive to Lakewood to eat? Man this chili's has amazing service!!! Every time I come the servers are nice, friendly, patient, and attentive. Good food, good service, yummy drinks that are generous with the good stuff,  and no mistakes on special instructions, just how I like my meals. Try the Taco pizza = fiesta in your mouth! Only downside is actually an upside, the wait can be long because the service and food are good and Carson is hella limited on restaurants.  Favs would include the burgers, tortilla soup (but it taste like enchilada), and the create your own appetizer. They make really good drinks, and my only gripe is that they don't sell milk shakes (still 5 stars though).

This is the worst Chili's location! I've been here a few times since it is right down the street from my boyfriend's house and sometimes it is easier than to drive to Del Amo. My very first experience there was a year or two ago with a friend. At the end when we paid the waiter asked, "did you want change back?" Yeah, I want my change! You don't know if you're getting a tip! And he didn't. I'm a firm believer in tipping well because let's face it, customer service jobs suck, and those people deserve good tips for dealing with people all day, but don't ASSUME you deserve the tip! It was really unprofessional. Anyway, this is the problem with this Chili's: most of their staff sucks! Last week I went with my mom and siblings and we were told the wait was fifteen minutes. It was about twenty five minutes into waiting when the waitress let us know the bar was also open for seating. It would've been nice if she would've told us that twenty-five minutes ago. Of course, I should've assumed so as well since at other Chili's it is always open seating, so no big deal. She had some kind of throat illness, couldn't even say the names loud enough for customers to hear, and so she had to repeatedly say the name of the next party in a scratchy voice. It really made me nervous because she seemed very sick, they should've sent her home or got someone else to host because she's in contact with the menus and so many people. Our waiter took about ten minutes to notice us, but when he did he actually turned out to be one of the best waiters I've had! He memorized our order, repeated it back to us perfectly, had our food out shortly, and gave us extra ranch and dressings without needing to ask. His partner, on the other hand, did not bring me the check when I asked for it. We had to ask our main waiter again! This Chili's is also always packed. Overall the only pleasant experience was my last visit with that great waiter, I forgot his name, but even that experience was only great during the meal.

This was our second attempt to go to this chilis and after the first terrible experience I can't believe we ever went back! We went in on a Tuesday around 4pm and sat at the bar. There was only another couple at the bar who had ordered take out and another couple sitting in a booth, when my girlfriend and I walked in along with a separate couple. They chose a booth and we went to the bar top. First of all, wash your hands before you eat after you touch a menu there! Disgusting!! Second, check all of your silverware! Of my two forks that were lying atop each other, one was pasted with something brown and came out of a napkin that was rolled by an employee! After ten minutes of waiting, Stephanie finally came out from somewhere and threw a coaster in front if us and barely offered us a drink. I know that chilis offers happy hour but there was no menu, and after we ordered a full price appetizer, I asked her if they had happy hour and she rolled her eyes at me and went searching for one, which was also filthy dirty! She walked off and for the next 15 minutes while we waited for our appetizer trio(that was served cold), I took the liberty of watching what was going on. My girlfriend is server at a fine dining restaurant and my expectation of chilis is never going to be high but there is a standard! Where we were sitting was right near the entrance of the kitchen and not one female there wears their hair back in at least a pony tail, and I know for a fact that they all serve and handle food because I've worked in a newer chain as well. Team service is supposed to help things along but there is no management at this chilis to ensure that's happening. In the 15 minutes we waited, the couple that was there when we arrived was mad at the slow service and wanted to cancel their order, and another couple that had walked in was asking if they could get some service. The manager was finally dealing with the people who were canceling but disappeared and wasn't seen again. All the while Stephanie spent the entire time running her hands through her unkempt hair and talked to another couple that came to the bar after us. She never asked us if our food was ok, which it wasn't and it was clear she didn't want us to order more. Too bad because I'm a great tipper and if she hadn't let me leave hungry she probably would have gotten the best tip she'd ever gotten! This chilis is the worst! We should have never gone back after the time we waited an hour for our food and after we complained and were told we'd be reimbursed and instead were charged twice! That phone call was a nightmare! SAVE YOUR MONEY AND GO TO WENDY'S ON MAIN!
Chilis overall is delicious. The customer service here is awful, the servers aren't courteous, i had to wait 35 minutes for a spinach dip.

Worst Chillies I have ever been to. The food came out awful. I had to send both dishes back as well as the appetizer. Our server was very nice (albeit slow) and Went out of his way to accommodate us. But for sure I won't be back to this Chillies.

Very disappointed. I've gone to numerous Chili's, and used to work for the company. I was embarrassed for this place. I should have know better when I saw that it has an AVERAGE of 2 stars. The bathroom was a mess (broken soap dispensers, towels on the floor, baby changing station looked like it hadn't been cleaned in days). Our server came to the table and had a dirty uniform (this was around 1pm, 3 hours after they opened). She forgot my girlfriend's coffee and brought it after we reminded her and already finished our food. She wasn't very welcoming or attentive. The "fresh corn guacamole" (that's supposed to be made "fresh" everyday) was brown. The manager didn't even know it was suppose to be made fresh everyday and tossed after 12 hours. We were given plates that were dirty and had huge chunks that were broken off. My girlfriend's sandwich was not made right and looked terrible. Her son's chicken breast looked like it had been sitting for 30 minutes before it was brought out. My food was decent. The manager didn't even know the name of my girlfriend's sandwich when she comped it. When she came to the table to apologize, she also was dirty and didn't look professional. Her and our server were nice. There's no excuse for how dirty that restaurant was. I am a manager at a restaurant, and can tell you that the reason this place has 2 stars is poor management. The food quality is poor, cleanliness and sanitation are poor, the service at best was below average. I can't even imagine what the kitchen or back of house look like, when they were ok with how the front of house looked. The only difference between this Chili's and one with 4 or 5 stars, is the management and staff (same recipes, same standards, same training). I will return to Chili's, but not this one.

This place SUCKS and deserves no star at all! We left this place after sitting for   a dirty table for Happy Hour & was ignored the entire time.   There was a girl that was sweeping the floor but there was no one to clean up the tables???  Really?  WTH!  No one around us was being helped at all.  Will never go back.

Not a bad or great Chili's. Service is always the same. I don't like their menu's. It's always overwhelming. I like the variety here but I think it comes at the cost of confusing people that take a look in their menu. Also, I feel like anything here that's good or looks appetizing is over 2000 calories.

Customer service was very lackluster.  We had to seat ourselves, because the host at the door did not acknowledge or greet us. We ordered two drinks which took more than 15 minutes to receive. Once we received our drinks, there was a bug in mine and there was thick pink lipstick stains on my husband's mug. We alerted the closest employee who was a bus boy, immediately. He didn't apologize. He took the two dirty drinks back to the bartender and our waitress, Jessica.  The bus boy, our waitress, the bartender, and the manager didn't immediately address our issue. Our waitress didn't come back. The bus boy came back a few minutes later with the new drinks, didn't say a thing to us about the drinks, just placed the drinks haphazardly on our table, didn't make eye contact, and didn't apologize. A few minutes after that, our waitress finally returned to our table with the food we ordered. Jessica, our waitress BARELY apologized about the dirty drinks that were served to us earlier and BARELY checked on us throughout our stay. It's been standard to get a visit from a manager when service and food fall below acceptable, but the manager never was alerted to the problem. Overall, it seemed to be an establishment culture to just sweep issues under the rug like they never happened. We are very disappointed in this establishment's management and employees. Been to this location previously, and didn't experience any problems with service or food/drinks. It's unfortunate that this Chili's falls below expectations of what a Chili's chain restaurant claims to be, because we're in the area frequently and would have considered patronizing this restaurant consistently. At this point, we certainly wouldn't consider coming here anymore.

On July 28, '13 my family & I ordered to-go via online. We customized most of our meals, sides, etc. When we went to pick up our order (at the confirmed time) everything was all ready, "to-go"! The guy that took our payment also went through each order before we left. Everything was there, made as ordered!!! THIS does happen. Thank you Chili's, Carson, CA!!! What a great way to end the weekend :)
Wait time was horrible, only been here twice. But they sit you down and forget about you. never coming back

Well, I normally enjoy Chili's but I dont know what this location is doing. It was quite crowded and as such I ended up ordering my food to go. I noticed that the sport bar area had  a few booths missing and placed a table and chairs in their place. Not only did it look out of place as it was done most haphazardly, it reduces actual seating capacity; my guess is another 8 - 10 patrons are missing space seating space with these tables vs booths. Tables are smaller and only hold 4, while booths tables are longer and can hold 4,5, or 6 depending on if its  a grorup of young skinny teen girls or a family with a baby or couple of kids. Overall quality of their food is still good and the general service of the takeout order process was efficient and polite.

I've been to other Chili's and have enjoyed it, this location however is TERRIBLE. I don't know what their management is doing but the waiters and customer service is just lousy!  We celebrated my boyfriend's niece's birthday here this past Wednesday. Please tell me why we had to wait around more than half the time for our waitress? She didn't bring us our drinks for 20 mins and 35 mins after we ordered we asked her where are our appetizers and she responds I kid you not "Don't chu know the food needs to cook baby?" Umm, are you kidding me lady? Never once did she ask us how we were doing as we were waiting. Finally after we got our food which was almost an hour later, we didn't see her until we had to remind her about the birthday song for our niece. It's like our waitress DGAF. She strolled around extra slow and had no sense of urgency. Maybe it's cause we had a party of 11 but there were 4 kids and she was already getting a tip. If gratuity wasn't included, trust me she would not have gotten one.  We spent over two hours at dinner mainly due to slow service. I honestly would never come back unless I was starving and desperate. Not only does the service suck, it goes to show that the management is incompetent to properly train their employees. Get your ish together please!

Chilis is a good franchise and i like their food, but management in this branch sucks!!! They have lots of free space and tables but the make people stay for a long time to fill their bar lounge which is totally stupid in case of customer service. Next time i will make sure not to come in this branch.

Ok. This place sucks! I live in Carson so I try to frequent my local businesses. I arrived at Chili's tonight at 8:20pm. I just walked out at 10:32pm. Believe me it wasn't because they were super busy. Understaffed. They sat us by the kitchen at a dark table. I couldn't even read the menu it was so dark. They finally moved our table and we had to wait another 20 minutes for drinks. Good came another 20 minutes later. I will never visit this place again. Terrible service.

I don't care for the food at Chili's. We came to drink and socialize. However, we had the friendliest, most amazing, most accommodating waitress ever. I wish I remembered her name, she was super awesome and needless to say, we left a pretty big tip.

I absolutely love Chili's, but this was by far the worse costumers service I have ever witnessed. It took our waiter 20 minutes to acknowledge we were there. And it took 20 more minutes for is to get our food brought to our table. I would no recommend this Chili's to anyone! No form of organizations what so ever!

Horrible service, very ratchet. I was upset. We got our check before we were asked if we wanted dessert, and got another check before our dessert even came. I asked what came on my entree the waitress told me what she likes to put on her's instead of what actually came on it. She forgot to bring us silverware. Even admitted to us how poorly she was workin today.

I personally love to try chains restaurants when I can't find any good mom and pop stores thinking I wouldn't be let down. But this place did big time. It's no surprise that it has a low rating.  I had to wait 15 min before a server came to us. Order an appetizer and it was cold. Waitress never came for refills. I can't say anymore. The reviews say it all. Management is horrible. I hate to be this owner.
My cheese wasn't melted on my pizza. The waitress was Mia. Thank god I was enjoying my handsome date
I am upping my rating. This place is turning around. The service is friendly and prompt and the restaurant is clean. Great place to watch football on the weekend.

If I could give 0 stars I would. Me and a friend stopped for a quick late bite ( we didn't want fast food ). The service sucked, we were getting to just leave after having our waters for 10 minutes and still not ordering. right before got up ( the bartender saw us getting our stuff together or overheard us talking) the bartender ended up taking our order. The guy who was suppose to wait on us was rude in bad mood and didn't like anything we said. At least the food was good. We paid, left no tip and got out knowing never to go to that Chilis again.

Service was excellent thanks to our server Shani in the bar area. Other than that the food was just OK. The bacon chicken sandwich was kinda, well, blah... and my partner didn't really care for the ribs he ordered. They were a bit small and bland. But they do have a GREAT happy hour and if you come sit with Shani. She's too sweet!

Group from work came to Chili's to say goodbye to a coworker who was leaving the company.  We had reservations for a group of 15 on a Monday.  The service was HORRIBLE-HORRIBLE!  It took forever to get our drinks, just cokes & water; I didn't think much of it until it took awhile for the 1st meals were brought, then it was every 10-15 minutes for others to get there food, with the last person receiving her food over 30 minutes after the 1st meal was delivered; that last person was me.  The manager came and just kept saying to everyone, I'm sorry she was so insincere and poor management skills.  She told us the waitress was given only our table so she can give us all the attention, but how can 1 person follow 15 orders and deliver drinks and food all at the same time.  There was several waitresses just standing around where they & the manager could of helped this poor waitress!  Really ms. manager?  Never-Never will I go there again!

Stopped by this location to have a meal before heading to StubHub Center. At first glance place was packed, but after a few minutes some bar seating opened up and were seated. LaToya was nice and straight to the point when ordering. She was checking on us often. Had the Spicy Shrimp Tacos with rice & pinto beans. They were ok, nothing fantastic but then again it's Chili's. Might return if I'm heading back to StubHub Center.

This is by far the grossest Chilies I have ever been to. My BF and I came in for a quick bite before going out. I ordered the boneless buffalo wings and her ordered the sliders. When my buffalo wings came out they looked gray. At that point I wanted to send them back, but I had to take a bite to see. They were the grosses thing I have ever tasted at a restaurant . They seem like they were microwaved and sat out for 20 min. I almost gaged when I took a bite as they were cold and soggy. I wouldn't of even giving them to my dog.  My BF sliders also looked bad. He said they tasted like carls jr., but worse. I normally like Chilis but after this experience I doubt I will ever be able to visit any location. The one good experience was the staff. They were really cool and my server took them off the bill. They really need to fix their food..  As its really Gross. If I could get a 0 I would, but the 1 could to go the staff.

Okay, I come to this city often because I'm in loveeee with IKEA.  Anyway, the family decided hey let's eat at Chillis, my first thought was OH NOOOO the service is slow and food is always lukewarm in Inglewood.  But they really wanted to eat here so what the heck. Service:  Our waitress was Staci. (5 star service) She was super attentive. Food plus stars: Hubby - Ordered bacon burger w/ fries. (4 stars) Son - Ordered the Old fashion timer w/ fries. (5 stars) Daughter - Ordered the Half stack of ribs w/ fries. (4 stars)  Me - Cheese fries, honey chipotle crispers w/ baked potatoes. (4 stars) I would definitely go back...

I used to frequent Chili's a lot back in the day.  I've seen the menu change a little bit since then.  However, the one thing I can truly count on is their molten lava chocolate cake.  This is the reason I found my way to Chili's because of my craving for that delectable dessert.  My boyfriend shared the dessert with me but I could tell he was holding back because he wanted me to get my fill of it.  The rest of the food is okay, but nothing all too amazing to come back for.  Like I said, I found my way back here because of the molten lava cake!
The food was great, good size portions.   I enjoyed my visit there, waiters were very friendly and attentive.  Especially Julian, he was the best!   I'm going back again:-)

Came back again to see if the service was any better. I called ahead and had my name put in I was told 30 minutes.  Got there and was told give them another 10 minutes.....it turned into 1 hour and we sat down after I complained to the manager we spent a total of 4 hours here. I had to ask for silverware 4 times and refills took forever. Its not our waitress fault was great just over worked due the fact they were short staffed. The manager was not even offering anything this time. I'm not going to make this a third visit but this was my last visit at this Chillis that's for sure.
We came early for dinner (5ish) and had great service to go with an exceptional combo meal; dry rub ribs and salmon.  By the time we were done the place was crowded. I reco getting there early.
It was alright, just about as good as you can expect from a Chilis

This place is one big FAIL. I know it's a Chili's, so you can't expect much. I didn't want to go here; my sister made me. The food is awful. The employees are even worse.  Chicken Enchilada Soup- COLD watered down liquid cheese with chunks of chicken floating around. Cajun Steak- Frozen overdone meat, unseasoned, and served with a small square of butter. Texas Fries- Cold stale fries with unmelted shredded cheese, topped with bacon bits  SERVICE- What service??? NONEXISTENT. Our chola-looking waitress went on a smoke break without telling us, and never came back. It took 30 minutes just to flag someone down to give us our check. Other servers, bussers, and even a couple of managers passed right by us, and acted as if we were invisible.

Their food was decent, but the wait time was so long! The waiters were also in attentive, maybe they were understaffed but he literally only visited our table to take our order, drop off our order an hour later, and maybe half an hour after that check up on our empty water glasses. I've been in many restaurants, especially packed ones during holidays but it was never this lacking. Avoid this place if you can and find another Chili's to go to if possible.

From the start it was bad, our table wasnt clean and the menus had food particles and sticky fluid on them from who knows how long ago. We pointed this out to the waitress but all she just said was"eww thats nasty" but did nothing about it.  I agree with another yelp user "I know this is chilis"  but you shouldn't have to clean everything yourself. Overall the service is mediocre  at best and the place is just plain dirty.

This will be my last visit at Chilis. Got the 2 for $20 deal, I ordered their new bacon avocado chicken and the chicken was super dry and bland! No flavor at all. My bf got the chicken tenders and it tasted like they were cooked in the microwave. I've always been a fan of chilis, but the quality of the food has  definitely gone down.

Chili's is Chili's but this location is awful. I ordered a steak, medium rare and it was practically raw, I'm not too picky about medium rare and rare but this steak looked like they threw it on and pulled it off. I sent it back and what do you think I got in return...a well done ribeye, and to top it off it was quite possibly the worst quality steak I've ever had. Very disappointed.

I've been coming here for years....I like the ribs burgers and lets just say I like this place a lot. Now I know all Chillis are different, and this one is. The staff is nice, good food and the drinks are good too. Overall if your looking for a good spot in Carson, stop here .  ,

The location was really loud.  Seemed to be understaffed.  Shay at the bar was really kind.  She made the drinks quickly even though we told her we were only waiting for a table.  She still wanted to help.  The waiter we had seemed a little lost.  The order came out one dish at a time over the course of like 10 minutes.  One salad was out and my friend had already finished half of his meal before the rest of the dishes arrived.  The chips and salsa were okay.  The chips were soooooo salty.  I had to dust them off just to get one down.  I ordered the new margarita chicken bowl.  Overall the flavors were good.  The chicken was a little dry.  Everyone else seemed to enjoy the meal.  I guess I do not expect much when I go to a chair restaurant like this.  I'll probably end up going back, but it's not the first place on my list.

So here's the deal... Got there just after 5:00pm. Waited inside for 10 minutes before someone finally greeted us. I suppose they finally thought it might be wise to sit potential (and I say potential for a reason) paying customers. We were then sat next  to the server station, the noisiest part of the restaurant. Noisier than all hell there... Waited ~10 more minutes for someone else to show... No dice. We did see one server drop a $hitload of chips next to our table. And, apparently the entire staff felt it was more important to sing Happy Birthday to another customer rather than clean up the rank a$$ chips on the floor, much less take our order. I swear... Never again... I'll go to Torrance or the Pike if I want my baby back. Way, WAY better at those locations...

Food looks good... On the MENU. I ordered crispy chicken tacos and the chicken were so hard that I only ate one. My mom ordered chicken enchiladas and they literally put a small amount of chicken. You probably can count how many shredded chicken were in there. Tortillas were hard. I feel like they're just microwaving the foods. Bad Place!!!!!!

The service was horrible, 20 minutes before being seated, 10 minutes before our order was taken then 1 hour before we got our food.. our appetizer was burnt and rushed i will never eat at this location again.
Just ate here and it's great! Servers are really attentive and the Ziosk is cool! Games and stuff! It's also prints out your receipts.  Today I ate at Chili's, today I ate in the future.

We must find another Chili's!  Very disappointed with the service and the food.  Our food came out separately,  it was five of us and when it came out it didnt look appealing at all.  Ribs with sweet potato fries looked blah and the enchiladas (supposed to be specialty) plate was sloppy and finally the fajitas were lacking in meat and flavor.   Lastly we ordered the skillet chocolate chip cookie and ice cream, smh cookie was overcooked and hard.   I have not been happy with their food the past few times I've been but today was it, from bad to worse.

I read a lot of negative reviews here so I was a little worried. However, our service (Morgan) here is fantastic and drinks/food came out promptly . Nothing to complain about so far. The restaurant is also very clean.

The food was decent however I didnt like the watermelon lemonade as it doesn't have any lemons or watermelon juice at all.  The service was so so and the addition of the tabletop touchscreen doesnt add to the experience in any meaningful way.  I was sitting there for a long time waiting for refills.

Tonight was my first time at this location. My friends and I walked in and no one was at the front desk to greet us, other servers saw awkwardly standing there waiting to be helped yet didn't acknowledge us. Overall, horrible service. Even if you hate your job at least try to make the best out of it or quit. Wouldn't come here again.
Worst service ever! Just left hungry after waiting to be seated. U better come two days in advance if you want service here. I know I'm not going back anymore...

Never going back. Place was dirty and staff was not friendly. After we got seated it took forever to get greated by our waiter. We ordered and appetizer that was brought out by a manager and I asked her for some ranch her response was" what's it for?" who cares what im going to use the ranch for. I have never been asked why I need ranch with my food.  The cleaning spray was also touching the water that was being used for refills and someone came out of the kitchen with a baseball cap to serve someone.  Very unprofessional!

Just left after celebrating my little one's culmination. Service was okay and the food was as good as can be expected - it is Chilis. Anyway, I'm writing this review because I really enjoyed the table side guacamole. It was delicious. Everyone enjoyed it.  Certainly a spot to go to, to catch up with a friend. And, I recommend ordering the guac! For only $7, it's worth it!

We owned Chili's today   ....... Chili's was so warm and inviting I had a blast eating here with my friends and family I'm back in Carson my hometown celebrating life and I'm loving it.    My friend is very ill and this is where she wanted to eat she invited me and I was happy to be here for her.  Our party of 15 was amped and ready for a good time.   These are a few of the things we ordered.  Triple orders of guacamole salsa and chips the guacamole was buttery and full of flavor the salsa was standard and tasty, the chips were light and crunchy and held up well under that thick luscious guacamole it was soo good I couldn't stop eating it.  We enjoyed platters of hot wings, egg rolls and mozzarella sticks that the tray was  devoured and they ordered more.    We enjoyed crispy fried onion rings with an assortment  of dipping sauces the onion rings were a bit greasy but tasted great.  I ordered a triple cheese pizza and added mushrooms it was crispy cheesy and delicious.  I had a refreshing watermelon lemonade and the refills were free.  My sister had a blueberry infused pineapple margarita she said it was delicious and strong.  Several friends ordered patron martinis with these cute mini patron refill bottles and the neatest little frosted glass everyone who ordered them loved the tasty cocktail.  My sweet friend enjoyed a few bites of grilled chicken and shrimp skewers chips and salsa she was very tired and never once did she complain. My sister's entree was steak seafood and salad her meal was wrapped to go after a few bites, she says it was perfect and that her son will enjoy the rest. Lol I ordered a slice of cheesecake to go it had two sides of strawberry sauce the cheesecake tasted alright it was a bit too dense and wasn't very flavorful.  I poured on the strawberry sauce and Kapow the flavor was kicked up a notch that strawberry sauce was fantastic.   Our party ordered way too much food and I didn't dare ask to photograph anyone's plate of food for fear of getting my fingers bitten these girls don't play. Lol Everyone loved the food and our poor waitress was kept on her toes with our huge party she brought out the food in a timely manner and was constantly refreshening our drinks.   We left her a huge tip and she deserved it. I often find myself in a predicament when meeting my LA/ Southbay friends for drinks. Well except for Chilis of course.  REMINDER FOR YOU FANCY FOLKS: This place is a CHAIN RESTAURANT, so please don't come here expecting anything  spectacular. FYI- Like most other chain restaurants, hardly anything is actually made fresh. Most sauces, soups, etc are frozen and NOT made in house. FOOD: 3/5 They have a few appetizers and drink specials for abt 3-6 bucks each- not too shabby. We got the southwestern eggrolls and the chips and guac. Guac was bland and under seasoned- typical. The southwestern egg rolls tasted weird and stale like they came out of somebodies microwave, but ill digress.  DRINKS: 3/5 I played it safe and stuck with Pino Grigio ($3.79 each)  and my friend got the sunset margarita(NOT on HH menu, abt 8 bucks) As i predicted, the margarita was all sugar- no liquor. BOOOO.  SERVICE- 4/5 Our food came quickly after ordering. Servers are friendly and attentive. Another plus is that they have mini kiosks on all of the tables at the bar, so we did not have to wait to order more food/ drinks or to get our bill.   FINAL THOUGHTS: This is literally a no -frills type of place that serves the sole purpose of meeting a friend for a brief catch up over drinks. Don't come here HANGRY- you WILL leave sad and disappointed. And stick with wine or basic cocktails/ well drinks. Until Carson steps its game up and opens more happy hour spots, my southbay friends and i will be returning here for an occasional drink or two. Or three.

My family and I patronized this restaurant on Sunday after church. We were lucky to find a table in the bar . We sat there for about 10mins before we stopped someone to get us drinks. Not one server came by to welcome us . So we order drinks and they come without straws. The server comes back with the straws and I find a floatie in my club soda. I ask for another. That takes another 10mins. In the meantime we decided what we were gonna order. We ask the gentleman if he was our server, because he never identified himself as such. We just thought we stopped a random server walking by, because that was how the interaction felt. He tells us he's our server. So we begin to order.  We have food allergies at our table. So I'm a little nervous because he's not writing anything down. I figured maybe he has done this before and continue ordering. I order a house salad, no onion. I look the server in the face and tell him that my husband has an onion allergy. To prevent any onion even being around him, I ordered my salad this way. I also reiterated this to the server. I ordered my main which was the Chicken Fajitas. Knowing that these are traditionally made with onion. I again ask for the onion to be omitted from my plate. Again reiterating that there is an allergy to onion at the table. Sizzling onions at the table would bother him. He says ok.  So the salads come out perfect,mine with no onion. At this time our drinks are beginning to empty. I start to look around and see our server sitting in a chair in the "to go" area. He's taking a break in the middle of our service while we all sit there thirsty. He finally decides to come by the table. We ask for refills, which didn't hit the table until after I asked the manager Patrick for one when our experience went sour. We will get there eventually.  So the food starts to come out. Here comes mine, Chicken fajitas with onion everywhere. Steaming onion aroma fills the air as they sizzle on the grill. I immediately look and say this is not supposed to have onion. Our server doesn't respond and just takes the plate away nonchalantly. I begin to get upset because I specifically asked this guy not to put onion on my plate. I even explained why I needed it not to be on there. I look over at my husband as his eyes get red and he start hacking. He starts to cough really aggressively. I ask if he's ok. I keeps coughing for about 4mins. I then look and he's turning red. I force him to go outside and get some fresh air. By this time the server comes back over and brings my friends food. Once again he nonchalantly shrugs off my husbands allergy. Who is now outside sitting on a bench catching his breath. My friend asks the server if he is remorseful, because he wasn't even apologetic. That's when we asked for a manager. Mind you only half of our table has food. Patrick, the manager, comes over and I begin to explain to him how upset I was by what happened. I explained to him that I have been in the service industry for 10yrs and I still write down orders. I work for Mortons The Steakhouse, as a server. Now I don't expect to receive the same level of service at Chili's that I give at Mortons. However, I do expect to not be served something I said I specifically didn't want. Patrick brings out our food. He also gets us refills. Which hadn't had happened until that point. He also informs me that my husbands food hadn't come out because it made incorrectly as well. Patrick told us that, we would have a new server Andre. He also told us he had taken 25% off of our bill. We finally all had our food. My friends were done, but at least we were eating. Our drinks were low again, as we were drinking with our meals. We were looking for a refill. However, it would be another 20mins before a server even acknowledged our presence. So we asked a server, some girl not Andre,for our bill. I still til this day. Have no idea who Andre is or what he looks like. So we wait, and wait. She comes back about 10mins later. She tells us there had been a computer issue and she would do her best to get our check.........Still no Andre. So we are beyond irritated at this point and my friend approaches the "to go" counter where Patrick is standing. She asks him for our check. He says there's a computer failure and there's nothing he can do. We tell him we just want to pay. Patrick then informs us that we can pay on Ziosk machine. That information would have been nice 20mins before. We pay our bill and Patrick can see that I'm upset. He send a lady manager over to ask about our experience. I told her the story and said I would never be back. They gave me some Chili Bucks and I still will never go to Carson Chili's again. After the food mess up, the service was still horrible. No one ever came by. The level of carelessness was disgusting. Though they attempted to make me happy it was too late. Food allergies are something serious. This location doesn't take them serious enough for me and my family.
